UI_MAIN_DISCORD_TAGLINE: Find New Friends, and Destroy Them
UI_WELCOMEMESSAGE:
Welcome to NEBULOUS: Fleet Command!

NEBULOUS is a complex strategy game with mechanics and systems that can easily overwhelm the unprepared.  It is highly recommended to play through the Fleet Academy to quickly get into commanding your space fleet.

Click below to go to the tutorial now, or find it later under the Campaigns menu.

Please keep in mind this game is Early Access and still in active development.  Thanks for playing!
UI_FILEMANAGEMENT_MISSINGMODS: Some mod dependencies for this {itemType} are not loaded.  This can result in unpredictable behavior.  Are you sure you want to load it anyway?
UI_FILEMANAGEMENT_CONFIRMDELETE_FOLDER:
Are you sure you want to delete the folder '{folderName}'?
This will also delete all of the {itemType}s and folders inside.  This cannot be undone.
UI_FILEMANAGEMENT_CONFIRMDELETE_ITEM:
Are you sure you want to delete '{itemName}'?
This cannot be undone.
UI_FLEETSELECT_WARN_OUTDATED: Built With Outdated Editor Version. Open In Fleet Editor To Update.
UI_FLEETSELECT_WARN_MIXEDFACTION: Fleet Contains Hulls Which Do Not Match Its Faction. Open In Fleet Editor To Select Faction.
UI_FLEETSELECT_OUTDATED_SELECTED: This fleet was built with an older version of the game and may cause errors.  Please attempt an auto-upgrade by loading it in the Fleet Editor, or select a different fleet.
UI_FLEETSELECT_MIXEDFACTION_SELECTED: The hulls of some of the ships in this fleet do not match its selected faction.  Open the fleet in the Fleet Editor to select a new faction for this fleet, or select a different fleet.
UI_FLEETSELECT_WARN_DELETESELECTED: You cannot delete the currently selected fleet.
UI_FLEETSELECT_LOCALMODS: All mods must be from the Steam Workshop to be valid for use in multiplayer!
UI_WARNING_NOFLEETS_BODY: This could be because you have no fleets, all existing fleets are incompatible with this game version, or you are missing necessary mods.  Build/upgrade at least one fleet in the Fleet Editor before starting a game.
UI_PLAYERPROFILE_MAXRANK: You've reached the max rank.  Congratulations!  Time to reflect on your long and rewarding career.
UI_MPLIST_TOOLTIP_COMPETITIVE: This server is a ranked and/or competitive server.  Data may be collected by the server owner in order to calculate ranks.
UI_MPLIST_TOOLTIP_RANKRESTRICTED: This server is rank-restricted. All players may join to spectate but only players within the specified rank range can play.
UI_MPLIST_TOOLTIP_AUTOBALANCE: This server has autobalance enabled.  Players may vote to automatically balance teams by rank.  Some servers may have team autobalance triggered by severe rank discrepancy automatically.
UI_MPLIST_MODFRIENDLY_P2P:
The host of this lobby has marked it as mod friendly.  If you would like to play with modded fleets, this is a good place to do it.

(Note that some mods may not be acceptable to all players, even in mod friendly lobbies.)
UI_MPLIST_LOBBYINFOFAILED: Failed to retrieve information for lobby {lobbyId}
UI_MP_FAILJOIN_INPROGRESS: You cannot join a game in progress.
UI_MP_BANNED_DETAIL: Your access to multiplayer has been blocked for reported violations of Steam Community Guidelines and/or NEBULOUS Multiplayer Community Guidelines.  You can still access singleplayer games.  You may appeal your ban via the ModMail bot on our official Discord server (link on the main screen).
UI_MODS_BASEGAME_DESC: Base version of the game, including all hulls, weapons, effects, etc.  Cannot be deactivated.
UI_MODS_GAMEVER_WARNING: WARNING: This mod has not been verified to work with this game version by the mod creator
UI_MODS_RESTARTWARNING: Changes to the active mod list have been applied.  The game will now restart.
UI_MODS_VERMISMATCH_WARNING: Some of the selected mods have not been verified with this version of the game.  While all mods can cause unpredictable behavior, using out-of-date mods can be particularly unstable.  Press 'Accept' to continue at your own risk, or 'Cancel' to automatically remove out-of-date mods and apply the changes.
UI_MODS_AUTOSORT_DOWNLOAD:
Some mods in the active list are missing dependencies.  Would you like to automatically download and/or add these dependencies to the list? You will be prompted before downloading any mods you are not currently subscribed to.

Cancel will auto-sort the currently active list only.
UI_MODS_ERR_DEPENDENCY:
DEPENDENCY MISSING
OR INCORRECT LOAD ORDER
UI_MODS_ACHIEVEMENTWARNING: NOTE: Having mods active, even if no mod assets are in use in the current game, will disable all achievements.
UI_MODS_CONFIRMSUB_WARNING:
You are not currently subscribed to the following mods which are in use by one or more players.  Would you like to subscribe and download now?  If you choose Cancel, required mods which you have subscribed to previously will still be loaded.

<color=red>Only subscribe to mods that you trust.  Click on a mod below to visit its Steam Workshop page.
UI_MODS_RATING_NOSTARS: Not enough votes to report Stars
UI_PROFILEEDITOR_BADGELOCATION:
Custom badges can be added to <install directory>/Assets/Resources/Badges.
Must be a {maxRes}x{maxRes} pixel PNG less than {maxSize:N0} bytes.
UI_PROFILEEDITOR_OVERWRITESLOT: Overwrite the existing color scheme in this slot?
UI_PROMOTION_MESSAGE: Your skills in the battlespace have been noticed, and resulted in your promotion to the next higher paygrade.  Now it's time to go buy drinks for the other officers so they can graciously celebrate on your behalf!
UI_SETTINGS_CONTROLS_REBIND:
Rebind key chord for action: {actionName}.
Depress all keys and release at the same time to bind.
ESC to Cancel.
UI_SETTINGS_CONTROLS_CONFLICT:
ERROR:

There are currently control assignment conflicts.  Correct them before applying settings changes.
GAMEOPTION_CAMERAFOV_TOOLTIP: Controls the field-of-view of the main gameplay camera.
GAMEOPTION_OWNMARKERCOLOR_TOOLTIP: Defines the color which will be used for icons for objects owned by you.
GAMEOPTION_FRIENDMARKERCOLOR_TOOLTIP: Defines the color which will be used for icons for objects owned by your team which you don't control.
GAMEOPTION_ENEMYMARKERCOLOR_TOOLTIP: Defines the color which will be used for icons for objects owned by the enemy.
GAMEOPTION_SHOWWIDGETHELP_TOOLTIP: Shows detailed help text on screen when using widgets (e.g. for selecting movement position).
GAMEOPTION_MOVECAMWITHSPHEREWIDGET_TOOLT: When a waypoint is placed using the sphere widget, the camera will move to that position so the widget is centered in the view.
GAMEOPTION_ENABLEHANDICAM_TOOLTIP: Enabled a cinematic camera which can be used by holding right click and dragging.  Add a left click and push the mouse forward to zoom.
GAMEOPTION_FLASHDCBOARD_TOOLTIP: When a component is damaged the corresponding location on the damage control board and status display will flash.
GAMEOPTION_FLEETEDITOR_TIPS_TOOLTIP: Enables new player tips in the fleet editor.
GAMEOPTION_FLEETEDITOR_WARNUNGROUPED_TOO: Enables warnings in the fleet editor when there is more than one of the same type of weapon on a ship that is not assigned to a weapon group.
GAMEOPTION_ENABLEARMORDECALS_TOOLTIP: This option is visible because your OS version has known issues with the compute shaders we use for our damage model.  A fallback version for the CPU will be used so armor damage is accurate, but damage will not be visible by default.  Enabling this options will cause damage visual to be copied to the GPU periodically.  This is slow and you will experience a performance impact, it is not recommended.
GAMEOPTION_ACTIVEPAUSE_TOOLTIP: Enables an active pause to give you more time to think, plan your moves, and issue orders.  Toggle the pause state using CTRL + Space in game.  Only works in singleplayer.
GAMEOPTION_ACTIVEPAUSESPEED_TOOLTIP: Controls the timescale when using active pause.  Set to 0% to pause the game completely, while still being able to issue orders.
GAMEOPTION_HIDESKYBOX_TOOLTIP: Replaces the in-game skyboxes with a black background for players who have trouble differentiating things against the brightness.
GAMEOPTION_DISABLECAMERASHAKE_TOOLTIP: Disable camera bobbing and shaking, for players with motion sensitivity.
GAMEOPTION_WIDGETPERSPECTIVE_TOOLTIP: Greatly exaggerates the perspective fading on the target lines for the sphere widget, if you have trouble identifying which side the cursor is on.
GAMEOPTION_CAMERAFLIPANIM_TOOLTIP: Removes the flip rotation animation from the camera when flipping the global up direction, if it makes you motion sick or disoriented.
GAMEOPTION_TACVIEWAMBIENCE_TOOLTIP: Disables the background noise that typically plays when the tactical view is open.
UI_FLTED_MAXSHIPS: You have reached the maximum number of ships permitted in a fleet
UI_FLTED_DELETESHIP:
Are you sure you want to delete the ship '{shipName}'?
This cannot be undone.
UI_FLTED_UNSAVEDCHANGES: Fleet has unsaved changes.  Are you sure you want to {actionName}?
UI_FLTED_ESC_TEST_TOOLTIP: Starts a quick test battle with the fleet you are currently editing on the Small Testing Range map. The fleet selection screen will be used to select the enemy fleet. Enemy AI will be disabled and ships will serve as targets only.
UI_FLTED_SOCKET_TOOLTIP_END:
Click to select component.

Right click for additional options.
UI_FLTED_SHIPITEM_TOOLTIP_END:
Right click for options.
Drag to re-order.
UI_FLTED_LOADFAILED_BODY:
An un-recoverable error occured loading the fleet '{fileName}'.  See logfile for details.

Press Continue to create a new fleet or Cancel to return to the main menu.
UI_WORKSHOP_UPLOADFAILED_BODY: Could not upload this item to the Workshop.  Error code: {result}.
UI_WORKSHOP_UPLOADSUCCESS:
{itemTypeName} successfully uploaded to the Workshop!
File ID: {fileId}.

{itemTypeName} already exists on the Workshop (File ID: {fileId}).
Press 'Update' to update the existing entry, 'Cancel' to upload a new copy.
UI_FLTED_TESTINGRANGESAVEREQUIRED: This fleet must be saved before it can be taken to the testing range.
UI_FLTED_OUTDATEDFLEETSELECTED: This fleet was built with an older version of the Fleet Editor, and file structures may not be entirely compatible.  Would you like to attempt an automatic upgrade or cancel loading?
UI_FLTED_UPGRADEFAILED_BODY: The automatic fleet upgrade tool was unable to upgrade this fleet to be compatible with the latest version of the fleet editor.  Please select another fleet.
UI_FLTED_SELECTMIXEDFLEET:
The hulls of some of the ship in this fleet do not match its selected faction.  Press 'Select Faction' to change the faction this fleet is identified with.  Ships that do not match the selected faction will be removed.

This will overwrite the existing file.
UI_FLTED_WARNINGS_CREW_BODY: {shipName} does not have enough crew to operate all systems
UI_FLTED_WARNINGS_CRITICALRESOURCE_BODY: {shipName} does not have enough of the resource {resourceName} to provide for the basic requirements of all systems which draw the resource continuously.
UI_FLTED_WARNINGS_LOWRESOURCE_BODY: {shipName} does not have enough of the resource {resourceName} to simultaneously operate all systems which draw the resource only when operating.
UI_FLTED_WARNINGS_NOCOMMAND_BODY: {shipName} has no command compartment (e.g. CIC) installed.  The ship cannot be controlled and will be abandoned immediately after battle starts.
UI_FLTED_WARNINGS_NODRIVES_BODY: {shipName} has no drives installed and will be immobile.
UI_FLTED_WARNINGS_UNGROUPEDWEPS_BODY: {shipName} has one or more weapons which are not assigned to groups.
UI_FLTED_WARNINGS_NOLOADOUTAMMO_BODY: {shipName} is not carrying enough ammunition for at least one loadout used by {craftName}
UI_FLTED_WARNINGS_UNUSEDAMMO_BODY: The magazine in {socketName} contains the ammunition type {ammoName} which is not used by any weapons.
UI_FLTED_WARNINGS_UNUSEDBUFF_BODY: None of the stat buffs provided by the {compName} on socket {socketName} are benefitting the systems currently installed on the ship.
UI_FLTED_WARNINGS_ONEROUND_BODY: The weapon {compName} on {socketName} has only one round of the ammunition type {ammoName} available.  Did you forget to add more?
UI_FLTED_WARNINGS_NOMISSILEAMMO_BODY: The missile launcher {compName} on {socketName} has no missiles loaded.
UI_FLTED_WARNINGS_INVALIDMISSILEAMMO_BOD: The missile launcher {compName} on {socketName} contains invalid munition designs.
UI_FLTED_WARNINGS_NOAMMO_BODY: The weapon {compName} on {socketName} has no ammunition available on the ship.
UI_FLTED_TIPS_POWERCONSTRAINED_BODY: This ship's power budget is tight and demand may exceed availability at times.  Exceeding power limits is OK, as not all systems operate continuously, but you should be mindful of situations in which many systems will be operating simultaneously.
UI_FLTED_TIPS_SHAREDEQUIPMENT_BODY: The {className} hull has a major strength in its ability to use equipment from the {factionName} faction in addition to the equipment of its own faction.
UI_FLTED_TIPS_PDAMMO_BODY: The ammunition quantity available for some point defense weapons exceeds 5 minutes of continuous firing.  It is unlikely that they would be firing continuously for more than that time, and those points could be saved for use elsewhere.
UI_FLTED_TIPS_OFFENSIVEAMMO_BODY: Some offensive weapons on this ship have enough ammunition for more than 60 minutes of continuous firing time across all ammo types.  Most battles last less than 60 minutes, and not all time is spent continuously firing.
UI_FLTED_TIPS_NOPD_BODY: This ship does not have any dedicated point defense weapons.  While not required for every ship, especially if they intend to operate in a group supported by other ships, not having them will leave the ship very vulnerable to missiles.
UI_FLTED_TIPS_NODC_BODY: While not required for every ship, having damage control can greatly improve ship resiliency.  Without it, a single fire can eventually burn down the whole ship.  Damage control is recommend for most ships, and larger ships should carry proportionally more damage control lockers.
UI_FLTED_TIPS_AMMODIVERSITY_BODY: The weapons on this ship have more than one different type of ammunition available to them, but the ship is only carrying one type.  Bringing a wide set of ammunition types can greatly increase versatility.
UI_FLTED_TIPS_REDUNDANTSENSOR_BODY: This ship is carrying two search sensors of the same type, and only one will operate at any given time. While this does provide some basic redundancy if one is destroyed, you can gain additional capability and redundancy by choosing a sensor of a different type.
UI_FLTED_TIPS_NOSEARCHSENSOR_BODY: This ship is not equipped with a general purpose search sensor.  Some specialized ships forego having their own organic sensors, but doing so leaves them completely reliant on other ships for target acquisition.  If the communications antenna is lost this ship can be rendered blind to anything beyond visual range.
UI_FLTED_TIPS_UNBUFFEDCARRIER_BODY: This ship is carrying a large number of spacecraft, but does not have any modules which improve its throughput.  Increasing sortie preparation speed and deck throughput can greatly increase the impact of your carrier on the battle.
UI_FLTED_TIPS_DIMINISHINGRETURNS_BODY: This ship has 6 or more modifiers applied to the same stat.  Stat modifiers experience diminishing returns and using different modules to improve a more broad set of stats may boost general capability more cost-effectively.
UI_FLTED_TIPS_WEAKCIC_BODY: This ship is an expensive and/or heavy asset, and its survivability in combat would be greatly improved by using a Reinforced CIC.
UI_FLTED_TIPS_KEYSTONE_SPINALMOUNT_BODY: The Keystone destroyer hull is designed around a spinal mount which can carry unique weapons.  It is recommended to use one of these weapons to take maximum advantage of the hull.
UI_FLTED_TIPS_XLSPECIALCOMPARTMENTS_BODY: This hull can be equipped with a Citadel Magazine, Damage Control Complex, or Large DC Storage in it's extra-large compartments.  These are powerful faction-specific compartments which greatly improve survivability.
UI_FLTED_HISTORY_SETSLOTMAGTYPE: Set slot magazine ammo type to {ammoName}
UI_FLTED_MAGAZINE_SPINNERUP_STACK:
Increase
    Shift+Ctrl = +1000
    Shift = +100
    Ctrl = +10
    Alt = Add/Round Stack
UI_FLTED_MAGAZINE_SPINNERDOWN_STACK:
Decrease
    Shift+Ctrl = -1000
    Shift = -100
    Ctrl = -10
    Alt = Remove/Round Stack
UI_MSLED_DIAGRAM_INVALID: Design is Invalid - An Avionics Package Is Required
UI_MSLED_LIST_UNIQUE: This missile is unique to this fleet.  You can use it in other fleets by saving it as a template.
UI_MSLED_LIST_MODIFIED: This missile has been modified since it was added from a saved template.  It will be unique to this fleet until it is saved to a new template, overwrites its original template, or is reverted to its original template.
UI_MSLED_LIST_TEMPLATE: This missile corresponds directly to a saved template.
UI_MSLED_UPDATETEMPLATE_BODY: Are you sure you want to update the original template file for the missile {designName}?  This will not update instances of this missile in other fleets.
UI_MSLED_REVERTDESIGN_BODY: Are you sure you want revert all changes made to this missile?
UI_MSLED_REMOVEDESIGN_BODY: Are you sure you want to remove this missile type from the fleet?  It will be unloaded from all launchers and magazines that contain it.  This cannot be undone.
UI_MSLED_DELETETEMPLATE_BODY: Are you sure you want to remove this missile template from the list of saved templates?  Doing so will not remove instances of this missile from any existing fleets.  This cannot be undone.
UI_MSLED_SEEKERMODE_TOOLTIP:
Sets the purpose this seeker is used for.  Seekers at the forward end of the missile have priority, and the highest priority seeker must always be set to TARGETING.

TARGETING: This seeker is used to acquire targets.  Seekers set to this mode that are not the Primary targeting seeker will be used as fallbacks if the primary seeker does not find a target.
VALIDATION: If the primary targeting seeker acquires a target, this seeker will be used to check the validity of the target.  This can be used for decoy discrimination.
UI_MSLED_UNVAL_TOOLTIP:
Sets the behavior of this seeker when there are no validated targets present.

ACCEPT: If there are no targets present that a validating seeker has tagged as valid, this seeker will still pursue one of the available unvalidated targets.
REJECT: This seeker will only pursue targets affirmatively tagged as valid by a validating seeker, and will ignore unvalidated targets even if no valid targets are present.
UI_MSLED_SMALL_TOOLTIP:
Sets a minimum target size for this seeker to detect.  'Small' targets are objects the size of missiles or fighters.

IGNORE: The seeker will filter out these targets, even when no other targets are present, preventing it from being distracted by non-warship targets.
DETECT: The seeker will not filter these targets, useful for building active point defense missiles.
UI_MSLED_SIGNALDISC_TOOLTIP:
Sets the type of signal this seeker will home in on.

ALL EMISSIONS: This seeker will home in on any emissions in ranges used for radar, including search radars, fire control radars, and jamming signals.
JAMMING: This seeker will only home in on radar jamming signals.
PULSED RADAR: This seeker will only home in on radar emissions from sensors.  It will not seek jamming signals but can still be jammed.
UI_MSLED_SUMB_TRIGGER_TOOLTIP:
Sets the conditions which will trigger the release of submunitions.

END OF PATH: Submunitions will be released when this missile reaches the end of its cruise path or when it runs out of fuel.
TARGET ACQUIRED: Submunitions will be fired in the direction of the detected target.
UI_MSLED_SUBM_ANGLE_TOOLTIP: Sets the angle at which submunitions will be released.
UI_MSLED_SUBM_RANGE_TOOLTIP: When set to activate on TARGET ACQUIRED, determines the maximum range to the target submunitions will be released at.
UI_MSLED_GUIDANCE_ROLE_TOOLTIP:
Sets the purpose of this missile. 

DEFENSIVE: Missiles can still be manually fired at targets, but they will also be managed by the Point Defense Controller and will automatically be fired at approaching missile threats.
OFFENSIVE: Missiles are only manually fired against designated targets.
UI_MSLED_DOCTRINE_THREATSIZE_TOOLTIP: Sets the type of threats this missile will be fired against, discriminating between Conventional (standard missiles like the SGM-2) and Hybrid missiles which have a sprint stage (like the SGM-H-3).
UI_MSLED_DOCTRINE_SIZEORDERING_TOOLTIP:
Sets the order of priority for target selection.

ASCEND: This missile will be fired at the smallest threats first (from the set selected above) before moving to larger targets.
DESCEND: This missile will be fired at the largest threats first.
UI_MSLED_DOCTRINE_SALVOSIZE_TOOLTIP: Sets the number of weapons that will be fired at a threat when PDMSL is set to defer to DOCTRINE.  This can be overridden in battle.
UI_MSLED_DOCTRINE_DISTANCEPRI_TOOLTIP:
Sets the order of priority for threats based on distance.

NEAR-TO-FAR: The closest threats will be targeted before working out to farther ones.
FAR-TO-NEAR: The farthest threats will be targeted before working in to nearer ones.
UI_MSLED_GUIDANCE_LAUNCHTYPE_TOOLTIP:
Sets the initial launch behavior of the missile.

HOT: The missile's engine will ignite immediately, good for getting the missile moving quickly when fired in range of enemy point defenses.
COLD: The missile will maneuver around the launching ship with thrusters until it has an unobstructed line to the target or first waypoint before igniting the main engine.
UI_MSLED_GUIDANCE_LOSTTARGET_TOOLTIP:
Sets what the missile will do if the target it has acquired is lost.

RESUME SEARCH: The missile will begin searching for a new target.
SELF DESTRUCT: The missile will self destruct.
UI_MSLED_GUIDANCE_TERMINAL_TOOLTIP:
Sets the type of evasive maneuvers the missile will perform on its terminal approach to the target.

NONE: The missile will fly directly towards the target and make no attempt to evade defensive fire.
WEAVE: The missile will weave from side to side.
CORKSCREW: The missile will spiral in towards the target.
UI_MSLED_GUIDANCE_TRAJECTORY_TOOLTIP:
Controls the approach angle the guidance system will try to maintain.

FREE APPROACH: The missile will fly directly towards the target, wherever it is, with no consideration for the attack geometry.
MINIMUM ANGLE: The guidance system will try to minimize the angle between the missile's position and the line between its launching ship and the target.  This usually results in a head-on approach for hostile missiles.
UI_MSLED_COSTBREAKDOWN_TOTALNOTE: NOTE: Cost is rounded up to the nearest full point.
UI_MSLED_NAMECOLLISION_BODY: The entered missile name is already taken by another missile or missile template. Would you like to automatically rename it to {newName}?
UI_MSLED_WARNINGS_DOCTRINEMISCONFIG_BODY: The missile {missileName} has a warhead intended to destroy missiles/craft but it is set to Offensive use. This missile will not be used for defensive purposes without enabling Defensive doctrine.
UI_MSLED_WARNINGS_SEEKERMISCONFIG_BODY: The missile {missileName} has Defensive doctrine enabled but one or more of its seekers are not configured to detect small targets.
UI_MSLED_WARNINGS_SEEKERREDUNDANT_BODY: The missile {missileName} has seekers which are similar and provide little or no additional redundancy or benefit.
UI_MSLED_WARNINGS_VALIDATORREDUNDANT_BOD: The missile {missileName} has validators which provide no benefit to the primary targeting seeker(s).
MISSILEWARHEAD_DETAIL_BLASTFRAG: Proximity Fuze, High Explosive, Blast Fragmentation
MISSILEWARHEAD_DETAIL_HEKP: Delayed Contact Fuze, High Explosive, Kinetic Penetrator
MISSILEENGINE_STAGE_WARN_NOSEEKER: WARN: No seeker, staging will not trigger.
MISSILEENGINE_STAGE_WARN_DIRECTIONONLY_M: WARN: Primary seeker provides direction only, and will trigger staging upon target detection.  Seeker range exceeds terminal stage range, and may not reach target.
MISSILEENGINE_STAGE_WARN_DIRECTIONONLY_S: WARN: Primary seeker provides direction only, and will trigger staging upon target detection.  Terminal stage range does not have sufficient fuel margin to guarantee hit.
UI_CRAFTED_CRAFTLIST_UNIQUE: This design is unique to this fleet.  You can use it in other fleets by saving it as a template.
UI_CRAFTED_CRAFTLIST_MODIFIED: This design has been modified since it was added from a saved template.  It will be unique to this fleet until it is saved to a new template, overwrites its original template, or is reverted to its original template.
UI_CRAFTED_CRAFTLIST_TEMPLATE: This design corresponds directly to a saved template.
UI_CRAFTED_FIXEDCOMPONENTS_INFO: Consistent across all instances of this craft
UI_CRAFTED_LOADOUTLIST_INFO: Weapon and utility loadouts selected before launch
UI_CRAFTED_MATRIX_FIXED: FIXED INSTALLATION, CANNOT BE CHANGED IN BATTLE
UI_CRAFTED_MATRIX_ADDITIONALCOST: Additional {cost} point(s) if any loadouts include this component.
UI_CRAFTED_UPDATETEMPLATE_BODY: Are you sure you want to update the original template file for the design {designName}?  This will not update instances of this design in other fleets.
UI_CRAFTED_REVERTDESIGN_BODY: Are you sure you want revert all changes made to this design?
UI_CRAFTED_REMOVEDESIGN_BODY: Are you sure you want to remove this design from the fleet?  It will be unloaded from all hangars that contain it.  This cannot be undone.
UI_CRAFTED_DELETETEMPLATE_BODY: Are you sure you want to remove this spacecraft template from the list of saved templates?  Doing so will not remove instances of this craft from any existing fleets.  This cannot be undone.
UI_CRAFTED_NAMECOLLISION_BODY: The entered design name is already taken by another design or design template. Would you like to automatically rename it to {newName}?
UI_CRAFTED_DELETELOADOUT_BODY: Are you sure you want to remove the selected mission profile '{loadoutName}' from this design?  This cannot be undone.
UI_SKLOBBY_SCARLETLETTER_TOOLTIP: This player was reported by other players {reports} times in the last 30 days, primarily for {reason}.
UI_SKLOBBY_MODS_PROMPT_BOTTOM: Click the button below to download and activate the missing mods.
UI_REPORTPLAYER_DETAIL:
This system can be used to report player conduct that violates the NEBULOUS community standards.  You may only submit 2 reports per day.

Select a report category from the dropdown.  These demerits will be entered into the player's service record.  Players with enough demerits will be highlighted to all other players in their lobby.  The report will automatically include the player's name, badge, fleet prefix, and a log of all chat messages they sent.  Additionally, if the report was submitted after a game, a list of all ship and missile names will be included.
UI_CHAT_MESSAGE_PLACEHOLDER: Enter message... (TAB to change Channel, ENTER to submit)
UI_CHAT_MESSAGE_PLACEHOLDER_WITHESC: Enter message... (TAB to change Channel, ENTER to Submit, ESC to Cancel)
UI_SKIRMISH_HOSTQUIT_BODY:
The battle is not yet completed; your team is still fighting.  Exiting now will cause all other players to be disconnected and the game to draw.

<b>You will receive no XP towards your next rank.
UI_SKIRMISH_QUIT_RETURNTOMAIN: Are you sure you want to return to the main menu?
UI_SKIRMISH_QUIT_RETURNTOEDITOR: Are you sure you want to return to the fleet editor?
UI_SKIRMISH_QUIT_SURRENDER: Are you sure you want to surrender?
UI_SKIRMISH_SIB_THROTTLE_TOOLTIP: Throttle Control Sets both the max speed and thruster power for the ship. WARNING: Prolonged use of FLANK speed will cause damage to engines; reserve for emergency use.
UI_SKIRMISH_SIB_MANEUVER_TOOLTIP: Maneuvering Posture Determines the directness of the route to the next waypoint. Evasive flight settings will make random course changes to attempt to avoid incoming fire.
UI_SKIRMISH_SIB_FORM_TOOLTIP: Formation Positioning Defines how all ships in the current formation take position relative to the guide. True positioning will keep the same true bearings regardless of the direction the guide is facing. Relative positioning will reposition escorts when the guide turns. Setting this applies to all ships in the same formation. In Loose mode the Guide will not slow down to let lagging escorts catch up.
UI_SKIRMISH_SIB_BATTLESHORT_TOOLTIP: Battle-Short Overrides equipment safeties to allow them to operate indefinitely. WARNING: Modules operating in battle override mode will receive periodic damage when operating outside their safe limits.
UI_SKIRMISH_SIB_RADAR_TOOLTIP: Radar Emissions Control Controls the radiating state of the ship's sensor suite. All sensors operate under the same uniform condition. Disabling sensors will cause this ship to become reliant on the sensors of other ships in the fleet, but will reduce its overall signature making it more difficult to detect.
UI_SKIRMISH_SIB_COMM_TOOLTIP: Communications Emissions Control Controls the radiating state of the ship's communications suite. Disabling transmission will reduce signature, making this ship harder to detect. It will still be able to receive the common sensor picture from friendly ships, but cannot contribute to it.
UI_SKIRMISH_SIB_ELECTRONICSUPPORT_TOOLTI: Electronic Support Modules Controls the activity of passive electronic support modules. Does not reduce signature, but can be toggled to reduce clutter once a sensor track has been acquired on a signal.
UI_SKIRMISH_SIB_WCON_TOOLTIP: Weapons Control Controls the ability to release weapons. Set to HOLD to be able to issue this ship targeting orders without actually firing. Weapons will bear on target but only fire when set to TIGHT or FREE. When set to FREE ships will automatically return fire with non-missile weapons on targets that are firing at them.
UI_SKIRMISH_SIB_PDTURRETS_TOOLTIP: Point Defenses - Turrets Controls the automatic or manual tasking of point defense turrets. When in MAN, turrets will only shoot at designated point defense priorities. When in DEDI, only dedicated point defense turrets will be used and dual-purpose weapons will be left idle.
UI_SKIRMISH_SIB_PDMISSILES_TOOLTIP: Point Defenses - Missiles Controls the firing of interceptor missiles. Click to open policy settings.
UI_SKIRMISH_SIB_DECOYS_TOOLTIP: Point Defenses - Decoys Controls the automatic or manual tasking of electronic warfare decoys. When set to LEAST, only the lowest-capability decoy necessary to defeat a given threat will be deployed. When set to BEST, the highest-capability decoy will be used for a given threat, even if a lower-capability one could have been used. When set to AUTO all decoys which are compatible with the threat will be fired.
UI_SKIRMISH_SIB_PDZONE_TOOLTIP: Point Defense Zone Controls where this warship's defenses will be targeted. AREA mode will target all missiles in range, prioritzing missiles targeting this ship but also defending nearby friendly ships. POINT mode will only target missiles directly threatening this ship.
UI_SKIRMISH_PDMSL_FIREMODE_TOOLTIP: Firing Mode Controls the firing of interceptor missiles. In DCTRN mode, missiles will be fired according to their programmed doctrine. When set to ALL, they will be fired indiscriminantly at the nearest threats, and in MAN they will only be fired at prioritized targets.
UI_SKIRMISH_PDMSL_FIREPOLICY_TOOLTIP: Firing Policy Controls the maximum number of salvos that will be fired at a target, not including Last Salvo (if enabled). MAX DOF will continue to fire successive salvos after the previous salvo's India time until the target is destroyed.
UI_SKIRMISH_PDMSL_SALVOSIZE_TOOLTIP: Salvo Size Controls the number of interceptor missiles that will be fired at a threat in a single salvo.
UI_SKIRMISH_PDMSL_LASTSALVO_TOOLTIP: Last Salvo If enabled, another salvo of missiles will be fired at the last possible moment, even if other missiles are already in flight to that target.
UI_SKIRMISH_PDMSL_NEZ_TOOLTIP: Craft No Escape Zone If enabled this ship will only fire missiles at small craft (fighter, bomber, etc) when they have been determined to be in the missile's NEZ. If the target were to turn away at max speed the missile would still reach it.
UI_SKIRMISH_DC_BUTTON_REACTORSHUTDOWN: Emergency Reactor Shutdown Initiates an emergency shutdown on all reactors and drives. Your crew will take 30 seconds to complete the shutdown procedure, after which time all reactor overload events will be cleared. All powerplant modules which were in the process of overloading when the shutdown was completed will require a restore to bring back online. It will take an additional 30 seconds to bring the remaining systems back online. Once a shutdown is ordered it cannot be countermanded.
UI_SKIRMISH_DC_BUTTON_EVACUATE:
<color=#FF2525>Order Evacuation</color>
This will cause the crew to abandon ship.  Once an evacuation is ordered, it cannot be countermanded.
UI_SKIRMISH_FLIGHT_DECKSTATUS_TOOLTIP:
Indicates Deck Status:
RED - No spacecraft currently launching or landing, free maneuver permitted.
AMBER - Spacecraft are on pads waiting to launch, but ship is not within maneuvering envelope.
GREEN - Spacecraft able to launch and land.  Ship is travelling at < 15m/s and is facing with 7.5 degrees of its velocity vector.

Click to toggle holding deck at AMBER status when craft are ready for launch, preventing them from taking off.
UI_SKIRMISH_FLIGHT_LOADOUTSELECTONE: Click to assign this mission profile to this craft only.
UI_SKIRMISH_FLIGHT_LOADOUTSELECTALL: Click to assign this mission profile to ALL selected craft.
UI_SKIRMISH_CIB_HARDBURN_TOOLTIP: Engine Hard Burn Turns on engine boost for this Flight, greatly increasing their speed but increasing fuel consumption even more.
UI_SKIRMISH_CIB_FORMATION_TOOLTIP: Formation Type Defines the formation this Flight will take. Options are Wedge, Line, Cross, and Echelon.
UI_SKIRMISH_CIB_MANEUVER_TOOLTIP: Maneuvering Posture Determines the directness of the route to the next waypoint. Evasive flight settings will make random course changes to attempt to avoid incoming fire.
UI_SKIRMISH_CIB_STANCE_TOOLTIP: Stance Defines how aggressive this flight will be when near an enemy unit. Aggressive will pursue all enemy units in range. Evasive will flee from all nearby enemies. Passive will take no action.
UI_SKIRMISH_CIB_WEAPONSRTB_TOOLTIP: Return To Base, by Weapon Status Defines when this flight will return to base automatically based on the remaining weapon load. WINCH will return when all members are completely empty on all weapons. SKOSH will return when all standoff weapons such as missiles have been expended, even if gun ammo remains.
UI_SKIRMISH_CIB_COHERENCE_TOOLTIP: Combat Coherence Defines whether this Flight will hold formation and engage a single target or break formation to engage multiple nearby targets when given an attack order.
UI_SKIRMISH_CIB_SALVO_TOOLTIP: Missile/Bomb Salvo Size Defines how many guided missiles or bombs this craft will allow to be in flight in a single salvo against a given target. Setting to UNLIM will continue to fire missiles until the target is lost/destroyed or all racks are empty. NOTE: This does not apply to command-guided missiles, unless the spaceframe is capable of controlling multiple at a time (e.g. Bombers).
UI_SKIRMISH_CIB_RANGE_TOOLTIP: Attack Range When set to Stand In craft will approach to within at least 4km of the target before firing any weapons, regardless of their true max range. In Stand Off mode craft will launch weapons immediately when given an attack order for a target in range.
UI_SKIRMISH_CIB_ATTACKTARGET_TOOLTIP: Attack Target Defines the type of modules on an enemy target this Flight will attemp to target. Note that this selection does not apply to some weapons such as autonomous missiles.
UI_SKIRMISH_CIB_RADAR_TOOLTIP: Radar Emissions Control Controls the radiating state of the sensors of all craft in this group, making them harder to detect but also leaving them reliant on other units for tracks or on their own visual targeting.
UI_SKIRMISH_CIB_DEFEND_TOOLTIP: Missile Self-Defense Controls when craft will go evasive to defend themselves from enemy missiles. AUTO will trigger automatically when under threat. When set to MAN, evasion will only trigger when Left Shift + Z is pressed for all craft currently under threat as well as all craft which come under threat in the next 30 seconds. Craft will always weave and evade when under close-range gunfire from other craft, regardless of this setting.
UI_SKIRMISH_CIB_DEFENSETACTIC_TOOLTIP: Missile Self-Defense Tactics Controls which defensive tactics craft will use when threatened by an enemy missile. Countermeasure deployment is used in accordance with the CMSR setting for all tactics. AUTO: Craft will determine their evasion tactics based on the configuration of the enemy missile. NOTCH: Craft will perform a dogleg maneuver ending in flying perpendicular to the threat. SCRAM: Craft will fly directly away from the threat. OUT-G: Craft will turn hard perpendicular to the threat at the last moment to attempt to exceed its turning capability. Craft will always weave and evade when under close-range gunfire from other craft, regardless of this setting.
UI_SKIRMISH_CIB_COUNTERMEASURE_TOOLTIP: Countermeasure Usage Controls when craft will deploy countermeasures when threatened by an enemy missile. AUTO will deploy countermeasures depending on the type of the incoming threat, ALL will always deploy countermeasures when evading, and NEVER will never deploy. To trigger manual trigger deployment use in conjunction with the DEFND setting.
UI_SKIRMISH_CIB_STATUS_DETACH_TOOLTIP: Detach the selected craft into a new Flight.
UI_SKIRMISH_CIB_STATUS_RETURNTOBASE_TOOL: Begin immediately returning to the ship that launched this flight.  This issues a soft RTB order, which can be overridden by issuing another order to this flight.
UI_AAR_SHORT_NOTE: This abbreviated battle summary is visible because the battle was not completed before you left (or an error occured).  Detailed battle statistics are only disseminated to all players once a victor is declared or the scenario is otherwise over.  To see the full battle report, be sure to stick around until the end to see how your fleet fared.
UI_AAR_AREA_DEFINITION_ANTISHIP: Anti-ship Warfare consists of all weapons used offensively against other ships, but does not include missiles.  Efficiency rating is based on a combination of accuracy and damage done compared to damage potential for all shots fired.
UI_AAR_AREA_DEFINITION_MISSILE: Missile Warfare consists of all offensive missile weapons used against enemy ships.  Efficiency is evaluated based on hits vs misses/defeats and total damage done compared to damage potential, weighted more heavily towards hits.
UI_AAR_AREA_DEFINITION_SENSOR: Sensor Warfare encompasses the effective use of all on-board sensor suites and electronic protection measures.  Efficiency is based solely on "stealth efficiency", which is a ratio of the time spent holding enemy tracks while remaining unseen by the enemy.
UI_AAR_AREA_DEFINITION_DEFENSE: Missile Defense considers the effectiveness of all anti-missile systems including point defense turrets, interceptor missiles, and electronic countermeasures.  Efficiency is evaluated based on the number of missiles determined to be threatening the ship compares to how many were defeated.
UI_AAR_AREA_DEFINITION_ENGINEERING: Engineering and Mobility considers resource generation and consumption, damage control, and resilience.  Efficiency is evaluated based on resource demand compared to availability, time spent immobilized, damage repaired, and the number of critical components restored.
UI_AAR_CRAFT_DEFINITION_STRIKE: Strike Warfare consists of all weapons used offensively by spacecraft against warships.  Efficiency rating is based on a combination of accuracy and damage done compared to damage potential for all shots fired.
UI_AAR_CRAFT_DEFINITION_VOIDSUP: Void Superiority measures how effective spacecraft were in engaging and destroying enemy spacecraft in defense of the fleet.  Efficiency is evaluated based on enemy craft destroyed vs friendly craft lost in each recorded engagement, combined with the accuracy of weapons.
UI_MULTIPLAYER_TOS: NEBULOUS: Fleet Command Multiplayer Community Guidelines and Standards. Online multiplayer, particularly in competitive games, is an inherently unpredictable environment. We at Eridanus Industries want the multiplayer experience for all of our players to be fun, enjoyable, and free from harassment and bigotry. To that end, we lay out the following guidelines to keep our community a positive place for all to enjoy. 1. Agreement to Terms By clicking the Accept button below and proceeding to the multiplayer match browser, you explicity agree to be bound by the terms below while interacting with other players through our game. Any substantive updates to these community guidelines will be brought to your attention through the resurfacing of this prompt. 2. Moderation Policy As a small team, Eridanus Industries does not actively moderate NEBULOUS multiplayer matches, as the majority of games are hosted on individual players' PCs or private servers. However, we reserve the right to revoke the multiplayer privileges (e.g. ban) any player who is reported to us, including for offenses reported or committed before these standards were implemented. Concerned players can make reports about in-game behavior via the "Report Player" feature or to our official Discord moderators via the ModMail bot. 3. Community Guidelines When playing online multiplayer games in NEBULOUS, players are responsible for their own actions. We ask that you treat other players with respect at all times, and refrain from any objectionable or disruptive behavior, such as: * Harassment * Hate speech or hateful conduct * Threats of violence and harm * Promoting or glorifying suicide or self-harm * Promoting of glorifying violent extremism * Sexual obscenity * Spam and fraud * Impersonation and phishing * Cheating, exploits, bots, hacks, and other abuse We define actions towards other players as any kind of interaction other players may see including, but not limited to: * Chat messages * Usernames/Handles * Fleet Badges * Ship Names * Lobby Titles We may remove multiplayer privileges from players that violate the spirit of these guidelines even if a specific action is not explicitly covered above. 4. Ban Appeal Players who have had their multiplayer privileges revoked via a ban can appeal that ban by contacting a moderator on our offical Discord, using the link in the bottom right corner of the main menu. 5. Data Retention & Privacy Players reported for poor multiplayer conduct via the in-game reporting tool will have their 64-bit Steam ID retained in an official repository along with all chat messages sent in the presence of the reporting player, all ship names in their current fleet, an encoding of their fleet badge image, and other information. This data is collected for the purpose of moderator review and is retained for at least 30 days and possibly up to 60 days. This data is only stored for players that have had conduct reports filed against them. Additionally, banned players have their Steam ID permanently retained in our ban database. Eridanus Industries will NEVER share this information with any outside entity. All collected data is necessary for multiplayer community moderation and cannot be opted out of if you wish to participate in multiplayer. 6. Release of Liability By proceeding to multiplayer you acknowledge that, while we will attempt to deal with disruptive players to the best of our ability, Eridanus Industries is not liable for the conduct of players and any negative results deriving from that behavior. Thank you, and we'll see you in the Battlespace.
GAMEOPTION_SCALESHIPSILHOUETTES_TOOLTIP: HUD icons for friendly ships will vary in size based on the relative sizes of the hulls.  The icon for a frigate will be smaller than the icon for a battleship.  Disable to use uniformly-sized HUD icons.
GAMEOPTION_COLORBLIND_TOOLTIP_RED:
Primary Uses:
- Enemy Units
- Component Damage State
- Bad Modifiers
GAMEOPTION_COLORBLIND_TOOLTIP_ORANGE:
Primary Uses:
- Priority Targets
- Component Damage State
GAMEOPTION_COLORBLIND_TOOLTIP_GREEN:
Primary Uses:
- Your Units
- Component Damage State
- Good Modifiers
GAMEOPTION_CONTROLS_CONFLICT: This control has a binding conflict with the following:
UI_SETTINGS_GRAPHICS_BAKESHIPNAMES_TOOLT: Disabling this option will prevent nameplate textures from being baked for ships, significantly reducing required texture memory for low-end computers or very large games.
UI_FLTED_FIREOUTSIDELIMITS_TOOLTIP: Allows this launcher to fire missiles at targets outside the traverse or elevation limits of the launcher.  Ensure the missiles have adequate maneuverability or they may miss at extreme angles.
UI_FLTED_SHIPIDENT_CALLSIGN_TOOLTIP: Optional callsign or nickname for a ship, so you don't have to choose between giving a ship a proper name or a utilitarian name like "Scout 1".  When a callsign is set it will be used in the ship list instead of the actual name, though the name will remain on the hull.
UI_FLTED_LOBBY_PLAYERINFO:
{ready} players ready
{total} players in this lobby
UI_FLTED_STATS_HULL_INTEGRITY_TOOLTIP: A hull's integrity directly affects how safe its components are from damage.  Lots of empty space means less structural members to absorb damage and protect mounts, compartments, and modules.  A ship with the majority of its component slots filled will have the full protection of the hull's Damage Reduction (DR) value, while a mostly empty hull will not.
UI_SKIRMISH_OUTOFBOUNDS_SHIP: {name} will withdraw from the battle in {time} seconds
UI_SKIRMISH_OUTOFBOUNDS_FLAG: {name} is out of bounds and will return in {time} seconds
UI_SKIRMISH_BATTLEOVER_RECEIVED: BATTLE REPORT RECEIVED - EXIT ANY TIME
UI_SKIRMISH_BATTLEOVER_DOWNLOADING: DOWNLOADING BATTLE REPORT - DO NOT EXIT - {progress}
UI_SKIRMISH_BATTLEOVER_TRANSMITTING: TRANSMITTING BATTLE REPORT - DO NOT EXIT - {progress}
UI_SKIRMISH_DEPLOYMENT_BUTTON_DEPLOY_TOO: All groups and ships must be assigned a deployment position.
UI_SKIRMISH_PDMSL_COOP_TOOLTIP: Cooperative Defensive Fire If enabled, this ship will coordinate with nearby friendly ships when firing interceptor missiles to reduce waste. ALL will coordinate defensive fire for all nearby friendly ships. OTHER will coordinate defensive fire to protect other friendly ships, but will also fire to defend itself even if other ships are firing. NONE will fire missiles at all threats if possible, even if other ships are firing. Cooperative Defense requires COMMS to be enabled.
UI_MPLIST_TOOLTIP_DEFAULTMOD: The host of this lobby has marked it as mod friendly.  If you would like to play with modded fleets, this is a good place to do it.
UI_MSLED_DOCTRINE_TARGETSIZE_TOOLTIP: Sets the types of threats this missile will be fired against, classified by missile size.  These settings govern how interceptors will be fired when PDMSL is set to DCTRN.  Interceptors will be fired at all targets, regardless of these settings, when PDMSL is set to ALL.
UI_MSLED_DOCTRINE_MODE_TOOLTIP: Toggles the complexity of the missile defensive doctrine settings.  In UNIFORM mode all threats will use the same rules for salvo size, priority, etc, regardless of threat size.  In MATRIX mode you can select a specific salvo size for each threat type and size.
UI_MSLED_DOCTRINE_ADVANCED_TOOLTIP: The salvo size threat matrix allows you to define the specific number of interceptor missiles which will be fired at a given threat, based on its type and size.  Each row in the matrix is a threat type, such as conventional missiles, and each column is a threat size ranging from 1 to 3.
UI_MSLED_THREATSIZE_ONE_TOOLTIP: Threat Size 1 Includes small, fast missiles like the SGM-100 Balestra, as well as light and/or utility spacecraft.
UI_MSLED_THREATSIZE_TWO_TOOLTIP: Threat Size 2 Includes general purpose anti-ship missiles like the SGM-200 Tempest, as well as medium-sized fighter spacecraft.
UI_MSLED_THREATSIZE_THREE_TOOLTIP: Threat Size 3 Includes heavy missiles and torpedos like the SGT-300 Pilum, as well as heavy anti-ship bomber spacecraft.
